metadata.title: CVE-2021-33203 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
Django before 2.2.24, 3.x before 3.1.12, and 3.2.x before 3.2.4 has apotential directory traversal via django.contrib.admindocs. Staff memberscould use the TemplateDetailView view to check the existence of arbitraryfiles. Additionally, if (and only if) the default admindocs templates havebeen customized by application developers to also show file contents, thennot only the existence but also the file contents would have been exposed.In other words, there is directory traversal outside of the template rootdirectories.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-33203` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-django - 1:1.11.11-1ubuntu1.14
python-django-common - 1:1.11.11-1ubuntu1.14
python3-django - 1:1.11.11-1ubuntu1.14
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python-django package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:1.11.11-1ubuntu1.14').
